title: Necrosis
author: ayobami
description: Reviewing your knowledge about one of the ways a cell goes to die; necrosis

questions.question: Necrosis is an active process of cell destruction
The affected cell swells in necrosis due to influx of solute and water
In liquefactive necrosis, the organ maintains its integrity / architecture
In the brain, necrosis usually takes the form of Liquefactive Necrosis due to high levels of microglia
In the limbs, tissue death is usually termed Gangrenous Necrosis
When a dry gangrene becomes infected, it becomes a type of liquefactive necrosis
Caseous Necrosis is a specialized type of necrosis that happens in the legs during a Tuberculosis infection, with a 'cheese-like consistency'
Enzymatic Digestion is the dominant force in coagulative necrosis
Protein Denaturation is the dominant force in coagulative necrosis
When severe ischemia occurs to most organs, liquefactive necrosis occurs
